page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY Page 2 _ BORTH
page.content: {Uppingham School}was evacuated to Borth in 1876 when an epidemic broke out in Uppingham. The boys and staff boarded locally and afterwards returned for holidays, and for a while Borth was called Uppingham by the Sea. They gave two slate seats to Borth and an East window and lectern to the Church. Uppingham playing fields P 17. {Storms} Borth is periodically reminded of its vulnerability to the stormy seas. The 1877 storm flooded hundreds of acres and sea water poured through houses. The last reminder was in 1975 when the main road was impassable, being covered by huge stones from the beach. {Fishing and Boat Building,}a tradition at Borth. Many ships were wrecked and lives lost,but their memory live on in the names of many places _ Hope_Well, Frienship Inn, Gleaner, Celtic et c..
